intro: Sicyos acutus, commonly known as the sharp-lobed gourd, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and melons. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has a trailing growth habit with hairy stems. Its fruits are typically green and can grow up to 15 centimeters in length. Sicyos acutus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
